definition: to see the world/to broaden one's horizons
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
surname Shi
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: He hated society and had little desire to go out and see the world again.
sentences.chinese: 他痛恨社会，不再想出去见世面了。

sentences.english: If I win a lot of money I want to see the world.
sentences.chinese: 如果我赢了很多钱，我想去见见世面。

sentences.english: For the first time in her life, mom and dad took her out to meet the world.
sentences.chinese: 今天爸爸妈妈带着花花第一次出去见世面。

sentences.english: We ought to face the world and brave the storm.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该经风雨，见世面。

sentences.english: However, we want to see the world, and we enjoy adventure. I am no exeeption.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我们都想见世面，闯天下，我也不例外。

sentences.english: Sailors do not earn much money but they do see life.
sentences.chinese: 海员们挣钱不多，但他们确实能见世面。

definition: to gain knowledge and experience
the wider world/diverse aspects of society
broaden, expand one's horizons
ken/scope
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to travel extensively
see 行萬里路，讀萬卷書|行万里路，读万卷书[xing2 wan4 li3 lu4 , du2 wan4 juan4 shu1]
pinyin: du2 wan4 juan4 shu1 , xing2 wan4 li3 lu4

definition: to read a book/to study/to attend school
to bear hardships
to read/to study
country bumpkin/boor/unsophisticated country person (humble, applied to oneself)/burial mound
to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
to yield interest, profit etc/to exhale (Buddhism)
future prospects/profit/to mature/to grow up
to go on a scenic tour
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to play/to have fun/to hang out
